Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland Cavaliers are on a four-game road winning streak.
The Mavericks have a 10-5 record in home games.
Dallas has a 2-4 record in games decided by 3 points or fewer.
The Cavaliers are 12-3 on the road.
Cleveland scores 122.4 points while outscoring opponents by 11.9 points per game.
The Mavericks' 13.4 made 3-pointers per game this season are the same per game average that the Cavaliers allow.
The Cavaliers score 11.0 more points per game (122.4) than the Mavericks allow (111.4).
Kyrie Irving is averaging 24.3 points and 4.9 assists for the Mavericks.
Evan Mobley is averaging 18.4 points, 8.7 rebounds and 1.5 blocks for the Cavaliers.

In their last 10 games, the Mavericks have a 4-6 record, averaging 110.5 points, 41.3 rebounds, 22.9 assists, 8.4 steals and 6.9 blocks per game while shooting 47.5% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 111.4 points per game.

In their last 10 games, the Cavaliers have a 9-1 record, averaging 123.2 points, 45.2 rebounds, 30.4 assists, 8.9 steals and 4.3 blocks per game while shooting 49.2% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 108.3 points.
Mavericks' injuries: P.J. Washington Jr. (day to day, knee), Dante Exum (out, wrist), Luka Doncic (out, calf).
